summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The record of the genealogy of Jesus the Messiah, the son of David, the son of Abraham:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham fathered Isaac, Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob fathered Judah and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah fathered Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez fathered Hezron, and Hezron fathered Ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ram fathered Amminadab, Amminadab fathered Nahshon, and Nahshon fathered Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salmon fathered Boaz by Rahab, Boaz fathered Obed by Ruth, and Obed fathered Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesse fathered David the king.
David fathered Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon fathered Rehoboam, Rehoboam fathered Abijah, and Abijah fathered Asa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asa fathered Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat fathered Joram, and Joram fathered Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzziah fathered Jotham, Jotham fathered Ahaz, and Ahaz fathered Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah fathered Manasseh, Manasseh fathered Amon, and Amon fathered Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah fathered Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time of the deportation to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the deportation to Babylon: Jeconiah fathered Shealtiel, and Shealtiel fathered Zerubbabel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zerubbabel fathered Abihud, Abihud fathered Eliakim, and Eliakim fathered Azor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azor fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Achim, and Achim fathered Eliud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliud fathered Eleazar, Eleazar fathered Matthan, and Matthan fathered Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob fathered Joseph the husband of Mary, by whom Jesus was born, who is called the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the deportation to Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the deportation to Babylon to the Messiah, fourteen generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus the Messiah was as follows: when His mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together she was found to be pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her husband Joseph, since he was a righteous man and did not want to disgrace her, planned to send her away secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he had thought this over, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife; for the Child who has been conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She will give birth to a Son; and you shall name Him Jesus, for He will save His people from their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all this took place so that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the virgin will conceive and give birth to a Son, and they shall name Him Immanuel,” which translated means, “God with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph awoke from his sleep and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took Mary as his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but kept her a virgin until she gave birth to a Son; and he named Him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, magi from the east arrived in Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Where is He who has been born King of the Jews? For we saw His star in the east and have come to worship Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Messiah was to be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea; for this is what has been written by the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah,
Are by no means least among the leaders of Judah;
For from you will come forth a Ruler
Who will shepherd My people Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod secretly called for the magi and determined from them the exact time the star appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search carefully for the Child; and when you have found Him, report to me, so that I too may come and worship Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After hearing the king, they went on their way; and behold, the star, which they had seen in the east, went on ahead of them until it came to a stop over the place where the Child was to be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced exceedingly with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they came into the house, they saw the Child with His mother Mary; and they fell down and worshiped Him. Then they opened their treasures and presented to Him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after being warned by God in a dream not to return to Herod, the magi left for their own country by another way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had gone, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, “Get up! Take the Child and His mother and flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you; for Herod is going to search for the Child to kill Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph got up and took the Child and His mother while it was still night, and left for Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stayed there until the death of Herod; this happened so that what had been spoken by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled: “Out of Egypt I called My Son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Herod saw that he had been tricked by the magi, he became very enraged, and sent men and killed all the boys who were in Bethlehem and all its vicinity who were two years old or under, according to the time which he had determined from the magi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what had been spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
Weeping and great mourning,
Rachel weeping for her children;
And she refused to be comforted,
Because they were no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod died, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up, take the Child and His mother, and go to the land of Israel; for those who sought the Child’s life are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph got up, took the Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Then after being warned by God in a dream, he left for the regions of Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and came and settled in a city called Nazareth. This happened so that what was spoken through the prophets would be fulfilled: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days John the Baptist came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is the one referred to by Isaiah the prophet when he said,
“The voice of one calling out in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
Make His paths straight!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John himself had a garment of camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist; and his food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jerusalem was going out to him, and all Judea and all the region around the Jordan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River, as they confessed their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruit consistent with repentance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and do not assume that you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father’; for I tell you that God is able, from these stones, to raise up children for Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the axe is already laid at the root of the trees; therefore, every tree that does not bear good fruit is being cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, I baptize you with water for repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than I, and I am not fit to remove His sandals; He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fork is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clear His threshing floor; and He will gather His wheat into the barn, but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus arrived from Galilee at the Jordan, coming to John to be baptized by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John tried to prevent Him, saying, “I have the need to be baptized by You, and yet You are coming to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, answering, said to him, “Allow it at this time; for in this way it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After He was baptized, Jesus came up immediately from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove and settling on Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, a voice from the heavens said, “This is My beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after He had fasted for forty days and forty nights, He then became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tempter came and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “It is written: ‘Man shall not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes out of the mouth of God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took Him along into the holy city and had Him stand on the pinnacle of the temple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down; for it is written:
‘He will give His angels orders concerning You’;
and
‘On their hands they will lift You up,
So that You do not strike Your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “On the other hand, it is written: ‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, the devil took Him along to a very high mountain and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to Him, “All these things I will give You, if You fall down and worship me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Go away, Satan! For it is written: ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and serve Him only.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left Him; and behold, angels came and began to serve Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard that John had been taken into custody, He withdrew into Galilee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and leaving Nazareth, He came and settled in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened so that what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet would be fulfilled:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,
By the way of the sea, on the other side of the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who were sitting in darkness saw a great Light,
And those who were sitting in the land and shadow of death,
Upon them a Light dawned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to preach and say, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee, He saw two brothers, Simon, who was called Peter, and his brother Andrew, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately they left their nets and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on from there He saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and his brother John, in the boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets; and He called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately they left the boat and their father, and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was going about in all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the news about Him spread throughout Syria; and they brought to Him all who were ill, those suffering with various diseases and severe pain, demon-possessed, people with epilepsy, and people who were paralyzed; and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds followed Him from Galilee and the Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw the crowds, He went up on the mountain; and after He sat down, His disciples came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He opened His mouth and began to teach them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are the gentle, for they will inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are the merciful, for they will receive mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called sons of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are those who have been persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are you when people insult you and persecute you, and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rejoice and be glad, for your reward in heaven is great; for in this same way they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt has become tasteless, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by people.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor do people light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on the lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Your light must shine before people in such a way that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not presume that I came to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I did not come to abolish, but to fulfill.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For truly I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, not the smallest letter or stroke of a letter shall pass from the Law, until all is accomplished!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, whoever nullifies one of the least of these commandments, and teaches others to do the same, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever keeps and teaches them, he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For I say to you that unless your righteousness far surpasses that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that the ancients were told, ‘You shall not murder,’ and ‘Whoever commits murder shall be answerable to the court.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that everyone who is angry with his brother shall be answerable to the court; and whoever says to his brother, ‘You good-for-nothing,’ shall be answerable to the supreme court; and whoever says, ‘You fool,’ shall be guilty enough to go into the fiery hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, if you are presenting your offering at the altar, and there you remember that your brother has something against you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave your offering there before the altar and go; first be reconciled to your brother, and then come and present your offering.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Come to good terms with your accuser quickly, while you are with him on the way to court, so that your accuser will not hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and you will not be thrown into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly I say to you, you will not come out of there until you have paid up the last quadrans.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery’;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman with lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now if your right eye is causing you to sin, tear it out and throw it away from you; for it is better for you to lose one of the parts of your body, than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if your right hand is causing you to sin, cut it off and throw it away from you; for it is better for you to lose one of the parts of your body, than for your whole body to go into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Now it was said, ‘Whoever sends his wife away is to give her a certificate of divorce’;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife, except for the reason of sexual immorality, makes her commit adultery; and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Again, you have heard that the ancients were told, ‘You shall not make false vows, but shall fulfill your vows to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, take no oath at all, neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of His feet, nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nor shall you take an oath by your head, for you cannot make a single hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But make sure your statement is, ‘Yes, yes’ or ‘No, no’; anything beyond these is of evil origin.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, do not show opposition against an evil person; but whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn the other toward him also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if anyone wants to sue you and take your tunic, let him have your cloak also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever forces you to go one mile, go with him two.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to him who asks of you, and do not turn away from him who wants to borrow from you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that you may prove yourselves to be sons of your Father who is in heaven; for He causes His sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Even the tax collectors, do they not do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if you greet only your brothers and sisters, what more are you doing than others? Even the Gentiles, do they not do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore you shall be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Take care not to practice your righteousness in the sight of people, to be noticed by them; otherwise you have no reward with your Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So when you give to the poor, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets, so that they will be praised by people. Truly I say to you, they have their reward in full.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you give to the poor, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that your charitable giving will be in secret; and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And when you pray, you are not to be like the hypocrites; for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the street corners so that they will be seen by people. Truly I say to you, they have their reward in full.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But as for you, when you pray, go into your inner room, close your door, and pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And when you are praying, do not use thoughtless repetition as the Gentiles do, for they think that they will be heard because of their many words.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So do not be like them; for your Father knows what you need before you ask Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
“Pray, then, in this way:
‘Our Father, who is in heaven,
Hallowed be Your name.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Your kingdom come.
Your will be done,
On earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if you forgive other people for their offenses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you do not forgive other people, then your Father will not forgive your offenses.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Now whenever you fast, do not make a gloomy face as the hypocrites do, for they distort their faces so that they will be noticed by people when they are fasting. Truly I say to you, they have their reward in full.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But as for you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that your fasting will not be noticed by people but by your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys, and where thieves do not break in or steal;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: for where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The eye is the lamp of the body; so then, if your eye is clear, your whole body will be full of light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. So if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and wealth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For this reason I say to you, do not be worried about your life, as to what you will eat or what you will drink; nor for your body, as to what you will put on. Is life not more than food, and the body more than clothing?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Look at the birds of the sky, that they do not sow, nor reap, nor gather crops into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much more important than they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And which of you by worrying can add a single day to his life’s span?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why are you worried about clothing? Notice how the lilies of the field grow; they do not labor nor do they spin thread for cloth,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: yet I say to you that not even Solomon in all his glory clothed himself like one of these.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which is alive today and tomorrow is thrown into the furnace, will He not much more clothe you? You of little faith!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Do not worry then, saying, ‘What are we to eat?’ or ‘What are we to drink?’ or ‘What are we to wear for clothing?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For the Gentiles eagerly seek all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But seek first His kingdom and His righteousness, and all these things will be provided to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So do not worry about tomorrow; for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not judge, so that you will not be judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For in the way you judge, you will be judged; and by your standard of measure, it will be measured to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Why do you look at the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ and look, the log is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother’s eye!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not give what is holy to dogs, and do not throw your pearls before pigs, or they will trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or what person is there among you who, when his son asks for a loaf of bread, will give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if he asks for a fish, he will not give him a snake, will he?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So if you, despite being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “In everything, therefore, treat people the same way you want them to treat you, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Enter through the narrow gate; for the gate is wide and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and there are many who enter through it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For the gate is narrow and the way is constricted that leads to life, and there are few who find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Beware of the false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravenous wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You will know them by their fruits. Grapes are not gathered from thorn bushes, nor figs from thistles, are they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So every good tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears bad fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So then, you will know them by their fruits.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of My Father who is in heaven will enter.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Many will say to Me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in Your name, and in Your name cast out demons, and in Your name perform many miracles?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you; leave Me, you who practice lawlessness.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore, everyone who hears these words of Mine, and acts on them, will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the rain fell and the floods came, and the winds blew and slammed against that house; and yet it did not fall, for it had been founded on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And everyone who hears these words of Mine, and does not act on them, will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the rain fell and the floods came, and the winds blew and slammed against that house; and it fell—and its collapse was great.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these words, the crowds were amazed at His teaching;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for He was teaching them as one who had authority, and not as their scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came down from the mountain, large crowds followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man with leprosy came to Him and bowed down before Him, and said, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus reached out with His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one; but go, show yourself to the priest and present the offering that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, begging Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying paralyzed at home, terribly tormented.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy for You to come under my roof, but just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man under authority, with soldiers under me; and I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard this, He was amazed and said to those who were following, “Truly I say to you, I have not found such great faith with anyone in Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And I say to you that many will come from east and west, and recline at the table with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; it shall be done for you as you have believed.” And the servant was healed at that very moment.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus came into Peter’s home, He saw his mother-in-law lying sick in bed with a fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she got up and waited on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed; and He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were ill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened so that what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet would be fulfilled: “He Himself took our illnesses and carried away our diseases.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw a crowd around Him, He gave orders to depart to the other side of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And another of the disciples said to Him, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When He got into the boat, His disciples followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a violent storm developed on the sea, so that the boat was being covered by the waves; but Jesus Himself was asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Him and woke Him, saying, “Save us, Lord; we are perishing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you afraid, you men of little faith?” Then He got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and it became perfectly calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The men were amazed, and said, “What kind of a man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He came to the other side into the country of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men confronted Him as they were coming out of the tombs. They were so extremely violent that no one could pass by that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cried out, saying, “What business do You have with us, Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding at a distance from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the demons begged Him, saying, “If You are going to cast us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Go!” And they came out and went into the pigs; and behold, the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned in the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the herdsmen ran away, and went to the city and reported everything, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus; and when they saw Him, they pleaded with Him to leave their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Getting into a boat, Jesus crossed over the Sea of Galilee and came to His own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought to Him a paralyzed man lying on a stretcher. And seeing their faith, Jesus said to the man who was paralyzed, “Take courage, son; your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, said, “Why are you thinking evil in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—then He said to the paralyzed man, “Get up, pick up your stretcher and go home.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he got up and went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowds saw this, they were awestruck, and they glorified God, who had given such authority to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus went on from there, He saw a man called Matthew sitting in the tax collector’s office; and He said to him, “Follow Me!” And he got up and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then it happened that as Jesus was reclining at the table in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and began dining with Jesus and His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees saw this, they said to His disciples, “Why is your Teacher eating with the tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard this, He said, “It is not those who are healthy who need a physician, but those who are sick.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now go and learn what this means: ‘I desire compassion, rather than sacrifice,’ for I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the disciples of John came to Him, asking, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “The attendants of the groom cannot mourn as long as the groom is with them, can they? But the days will come when the groom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But no one puts a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch pulls away from the garment, and a worse tear results.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor do people put new wine into old wineskins; otherwise the wineskins burst, and the wine pours out and the wineskins are ruined; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While He was saying these things to them, behold, a synagogue official came and bowed down before Him, and said, “My daughter has just died; but come and lay Your hand on her, and she will become alive again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up from the table and began to accompany him, along with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind Him, and touched the border of His cloak;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for she was saying to herself, “If I only touch His cloak, I will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, turning and seeing her, said, “Daughter, take courage; your faith has made you well.” And at once the woman was made well.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus came into the official’s house and saw the flute players and the crowd in noisy disorder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Leave; for the girl has not died, but is asleep.” And they began laughing at Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowd had been sent out, He entered and took her by the hand, and the girl got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this news spread throughout that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus went on from there, two men who were blind followed Him, crying out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after He entered the house, the men who were blind came up to Him, and Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then He touched their eyes, saying, “It shall be done for you according to your faith.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See that no one knows about this!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they went out and spread the news about Him throughout that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going out, behold, a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak was brought to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the demon was cast out, the man who was previously unable to speak talked; and the crowds were amazed, and were saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees were saying, “He casts out the demons by the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was going through all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing the crowds, He felt compassion for them, because they were distressed and downcast, like sheep without a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, plead with the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into His harvest.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus summoned His twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and his brother Andrew; and James the son of Zebedee, and his brother John;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Zealot, and Judas Iscariot, the one who also betrayed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twelve Jesus sent out after instructing them, saying, “Do not go on a road to Gentiles, and do not enter a city of Samaritans;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but rather go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as you go, preach, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven has come near.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse those with leprosy, cast out demons. Freely you received, freely give.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Do not acquire gold, or silver, or copper for your money belts,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: or a bag for your journey, or even two tunics, or sandals, or a staff; for the worker is deserving of his support.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whatever city or village you enter, inquire who is worthy in it, and stay at his house until you leave that city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As you enter the house, give it your greeting.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If the house is worthy, see that your blessing of peace comes upon it. But if it is not worthy, take back your blessing of peace.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever does not receive you nor listen to your words, as you leave that house or city, shake the dust off your feet.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment, than for that city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves; so be as wary as serpents, and as innocent as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But be on guard against people, for they will hand you over to the courts and flog you in their synagogues;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and you will even be brought before governors and kings on My account, as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they hand you over, do not worry about how or what you are to say; for what you are to say will be given you in that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For it is not you who are speaking, but it is the Spirit of your Father who is speaking in you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Now brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And you will be hated by all because of My name, but it is the one who has endured to the end who will be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “But whenever they persecute you in one city, flee to the next; for truly I say to you, you will not finish going through the cities of Israel until the Son of Man comes.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a slave above his master.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for the disciple that he may become like his teacher, and the slave like his master. If they have called the head of the house Beelzebul, how much more will they insult the members of his household!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So do not fear them, for there is nothing concealed that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What I tell you in the darkness, tell in the light; and what you hear whispered in your ear, proclaim on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And do not be afraid of those who kill the body but are unable to kill the soul; but rather fear Him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Are two sparrows not sold for an assarion? And yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But even the hairs of your head are all counted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So do not fear; you are more valuable than a great number of sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore, everyone who confesses Me before people, I will also confess him before My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whoever denies Me before people, I will also deny him before My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not think that I came to bring peace on the earth; I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I came to turn a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and a person’s enemies will be the members of his household.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The one who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me; and the one who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the one who does not take his cross and follow after Me is not worthy of Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who has found his life will lose it, and the one who has lost his life on My account will find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The one who receives you receives Me, and the one who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward; and the one who receives a righteous person in the name of a righteous person shall receive a righteous person’s reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he shall by no means lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus had finished giving instructions to His twelve disciples, He went on from there to teach and preach in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while in prison, John heard about the works of Christ, and he sent word by his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Him, “Are You the Coming One, or are we to look for someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Go and report to John what you hear and see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who are blind receive sight and those who limp walk, those with leprosy are cleansed and those who are deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is any person who does not take offense at Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As these disciples of John were going away, Jesus began speaking to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ palaces!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and one who is more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the one about whom it is written:
‘Behold, I am sending My messenger ahead of You,
Who will prepare Your way before You.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, among those born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptist! Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven has been treated violently, and violent men take it by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you are willing to accept it, John himself is Elijah who was to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call out to the other children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a song of mourning, and you did not mourn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a heavy drinker, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ And yet wisdom is vindicated by her deeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He began to reprimand the cities in which most of His miracles were done, because they did not repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that occurred in you had occurred in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will not be exalted to heaven, will you? You will be brought down to Hades! For if the miracles that occurred in you had occurred in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I say to you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom on the day of judgment, than for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus said, “I praise You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and have revealed them to infants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, Father, for this way was well pleasing in Your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been handed over to Me by My Father; and no one knows the Son except the Father; nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and anyone to whom the Son determines to reveal Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come to Me, all who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My yoke is comfortable, and My burden is light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath, and His disciples became hungry and began to pick the heads of grain and eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisees saw this, they said to Him, “Look, Your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on a Sabbath!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he became hungry, he and his companions—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered the house of God, and they ate the consecrated bread, which was not lawful for him to eat nor for those with him, but for the priests alone?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or have you not read in the Law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple violate the Sabbath, and yet are innocent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you that something greater than the temple is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you had known what this means: ‘I desire compassion, rather than sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Departing from there, He went into their synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man was there whose hand was withered. And they questioned Jesus, asking, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”—so that they might bring charges against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “What man is there among you who has a sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will he not take hold of it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much more valuable then is a person than a sheep! So then, it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand!” He stretched it out, and it was restored to normal, like the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees went out and conspired against Him, as to how they might destroy Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, aware of this, withdrew from there. Many followed Him, and He healed them all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and warned them not to tell who He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened so that what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet would be fulfilled:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He will not quarrel, nor cry out;
Nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A bent reed He will not break off,
And a dimly burning wick He will not extinguish,
Until He leads justice to victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in His name the Gentiles will hope.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a demon-possessed man who was blind and unable to speak was brought to Jesus, and He healed him so that the man who was unable to speak talked and could see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the crowds were amazed and were saying, “This man cannot be the Son of David, can he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, “This man casts out demons only by Beelzebul the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste; and no city or house divided against itself will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan is casting out Satan, he has become divided against himself; how then will his kingdom stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if by Beelzebul I cast out the demons, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore, they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out the demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or, how can anyone enter the strong man’s house and carry off his property, unless he first ties up the strong man? And then he will plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is not with Me is against Me; and the one who does not gather with Me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore I say to you, every sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven people, but blasphemy against the Spirit shall not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it shall be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, either in this age or in the age to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Either assume the tree to be good as well as its fruit good, or assume the tree to be bad as well as its fruit bad; for the tree is known by its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, express any good things? For the mouth speaks from that which fills the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good person brings out of his good treasure good things; and the evil person brings out of his evil treasure evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that for every careless word that people speak, they will give an account of it on the day of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees said to Him, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said to them, “An evil and adulterous generation craves a sign; and so no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for just as Jonah was in the stomach of the sea monster for three days and three nights, so will the Son of Man be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up with this generation at the judgment, and will condemn it because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise up with this generation at the judgment and will condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when the unclean spirit comes out of a person, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, and does not find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came’; and when it comes, it finds it unoccupied, swept, and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings along with it seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they come in and live there; and the last condition of that person becomes worse than the first. That is the way it will also be with this evil generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was still speaking to the crowds, behold, His mother and brothers were standing outside, seeking to speak to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [Someone said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, seeking to speak to You.”]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied to the one who was telling Him and said, “Who is My mother, and who are My brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And extending His hand toward His disciples, He said, “Behold: My mother and My brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of My Father who is in heaven, he is My brother, and sister, and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Jesus had gone out of the house and was sitting by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And large crowds gathered to Him, so He got into a boat and sat down, and the whole crowd was standing on the beach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He told them many things in parables, saying, “Behold, the sower went out to sow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as he sowed, some seeds fell beside the road, and the birds came and ate them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell on the rocky places, where they did not have much soil; and they sprang up immediately, because they had no depth of soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after the sun rose, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns came up and choked them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others fell on the good soil and yielded a crop, some a hundred, some sixty, and some thirty times as much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has ears, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples came up and said to Him, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered them, “To you it has been granted to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has, to him more shall be given, and he will have an abundance; but whoever does not have, even what he has shall be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I speak to them in parables; because while seeing they do not see, and while hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the heart of this people has become dull,
With their ears they scarcely hear,
And they have closed their eyes,
Otherwise they might see with their eyes,
Hear with their ears,
Understand with their heart, and return,
And I would heal them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But blessed are your eyes, because they see; and your ears, because they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly I say to you that many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen then to the parable of the sower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what has been sown in his heart. This is the one sown with seed beside the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one sown with seed on the rocky places, this is the one who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet he has no firm root in himself, but is only temporary, and when affliction or persecution occurs because of the word, immediately he falls away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one sown with seed among the thorns, this is the one who hears the word, and the anxiety of the world and the deceitfulness of wealth choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one sown with seed on the good soil, this is the one who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces, some a hundred, some sixty, and some thirty times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus presented another parable to them, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while his men were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the wheat sprouted and produced grain, then the weeds also became evident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the slaves of the landowner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have weeds?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, ‘An enemy has done this!’ The slaves said to him, ‘Do you want us, then, to go and gather them up?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, ‘No; while you are gathering up the weeds, you may uproot the wheat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Allow both to grow together until the harvest; and at the time of the harvest I will say to the reapers, “First gather up the weeds and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He presented another parable to them, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a person took and sowed in his field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this is smaller than all the other seeds, but when it is fully grown, it is larger than the garden plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the sky come and nest in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke another parable to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three sata of flour until it was all leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these things Jesus spoke to the crowds in parables, and He did not speak anything to them without a parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then He left the crowds and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him and said, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the field is the world; and as for the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom; and the weeds are the sons of the evil one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the enemy who sowed them is the devil, and the harvest is the end of the age; and the reapers are angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So just as the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire, so shall it be at the end of the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will send forth His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all stumbling blocks, and those who commit lawlessness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will throw them into the furnace of fire; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will shine forth like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. The one who has ears, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man found and hid again; and from joy over it he goes and sells everything that he has, and buys that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant seeking fine pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and upon finding one pearl of great value, he went and sold everything that he had and bought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered fish of every kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when it was filled, they pulled it up on the beach; and they sat down and gathered the good fish into containers, but the bad they threw away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it will be at the end of the age: the angels will come forth and remove the wicked from among the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will throw them into the furnace of fire; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you understood all these things?” They said to Him, “Yes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Therefore every scribe who has become a disciple of the kingdom of heaven is like a head of a household, who brings out of his treasure new things and old.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these parables, He departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He came to His hometown and began teaching them in their synagogue, with the result that they were astonished, and said, “Where did this man acquire this wisdom and these miraculous powers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is His mother not called Mary, and His brothers, James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man acquire all these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took offense at Him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not dishonored except in his hometown and in his own household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He did not do many miracles there because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the news about Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he himself has been raised from the dead, and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when Herod had John arrested, he bound him and put him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John had been saying to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although Herod wanted to put him to death, he feared the crowd, because they regarded John as a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so much that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after being prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although he was grieved, the king commanded it to be given because of his oaths and his dinner guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent word and had John beheaded in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s disciples came and took away the body and buried it; and they went and reported to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard about John, He withdrew from there in a boat to a secluded place by Himself; and when the people heard about this, they followed Him on foot from the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came ashore, He saw a large crowd, and felt compassion for them and healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening, the disciples came to Him and said, “This place is secluded and the hour is already past to eat; send the crowds away, so that they may go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to go; you give them something to eat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “We have nothing here except five loaves and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Bring them here to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ordering the crowds to sit down on the grass, He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looked up toward heaven. He blessed the food and breaking the loaves, He gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces: twelve full baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were about five thousand men who ate, besides women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately afterward He compelled the disciples to get into the boat and to go ahead of Him to the other side, while He sent the crowds away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After He had sent the crowds away, He went up on the mountain by Himself to pray; and when it was evening, He was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the boat was already a long distance from the land, battered by the waves; for the wind was contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were terrified, and said, “It is a ghost!” And they cried out in fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Take courage, it is I; do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter responded and said to Him, “Lord, if it is You, command me to come to You on the water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Come!” And Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water, and came toward Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seeing the wind, he became frightened, and when he began to sink, he cried out, saying, “Lord, save me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus reached out with His hand and took hold of him, and said to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they got into the boat, the wind stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were in the boat worshiped Him, saying, “You are truly God’s Son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent word into all that surrounding region and brought to Him all who were sick;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they pleaded with Him that they might just touch the border of His cloak; and all who touched it were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do Your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said to them, “Why do you yourselves also break the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God said, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and, ‘The one who speaks evil of father or mother is to be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or mother, “Whatever I have that would help you has been given to God,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is not to honor his father or mother.’ And by this you have invalidated the word of God for the sake of your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites, rightly did Isaiah prophesy about you, by saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This people honors Me with their lips,
But their heart is far away from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in vain do they worship Me,
Teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus called the crowd to Him, He said to them, “Hear and understand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not what enters the mouth that defiles the person, but what comes out of the mouth, this defiles the person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this statement?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “Every plant which My heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leave them alone; they are blind guides of blind people. And if a person who is blind guides another who is blind, both will fall into a pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Explain the parable to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Are you also still lacking in understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not understand that everything that goes into the mouth passes into the stomach, and is eliminated?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and those things defile the person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murders, acts of adultery, other immoral sexual acts, thefts, false testimonies, and slanderous statements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things that defile the person; but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile the person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went away from there, and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a Canaanite woman from that region came out and began to cry out, saying, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David; my daughter is severely demon-possessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He did not answer her with even a word. And His disciples came up and urged Him, saying, “Send her away, because she keeps shouting at us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she came and began to bow down before Him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He answered and said, “It is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Yes, Lord; but please help, for even the dogs feed on the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to her, “O woman, your faith is great; it shall be done for you as you desire.” And her daughter was healed at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Departing from there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee, and after going up on the mountain, He was sitting there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And large crowds came to Him bringing with them those who were limping, had impaired limbs, were blind, or were unable to speak, and many others, and they laid them down at His feet; and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
