verses.text: So the crowd was astonished as they saw those who were unable to speak talking, those with impaired limbs restored, those who were limping walking around, and those who were blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus called His disciples to Him and said, “I feel compassion for the people, because they have remained with Me now for three days and have nothing to eat; and I do not want to send them away hungry, for they might faint on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to Him, “Where would we get so many loaves in this desolate place to satisfy such a large crowd?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He directed the people to sit down on the ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He took the seven loaves and the fish; and after giving thanks, He broke them and started giving them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces, seven large baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sending away the crowds, Jesus got into the boat and came to the region of Magadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came up, and putting Jesus to the test, they asked Him to show them a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He replied to them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning, ‘There will be a storm today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but are you unable to discern the signs of the times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An evil and adulterous generation wants a sign; and so a sign will not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah.” And He left them and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples came to the other side of the sea, but they had forgotten to bring any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Watch out and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to discuss this among themselves, saying, “He said that because we did not bring any bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, aware of this, said, “You men of little faith, why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you have no bread?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not yet understand nor remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets you picked up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many large baskets you picked up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it that you do not understand that I did not speak to you about bread? But beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they understood that He did not say to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He was asking His disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Some say John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; and still others, Jeremiah, or one of the other prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you yourselves say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon Barjona, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I also say to you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build My church; and the gates of Hades will not overpower it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; and whatever you bind on earth shall have been bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall have been loosed in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He gave the disciples strict orders that they were to tell no one that He was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to point out to His disciples that it was necessary for Him to go to Jerusalem and to suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and to be killed, and to be raised up on the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “God forbid it, Lord! This shall never happen to You!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to Me; for you are not setting your mind on God’s purposes, but men’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone wants to come after Me, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what good will it do a person if he gains the whole world, but forfeits his soul? Or what will a person give in exchange for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is going to come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and will then repay every person according to his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I say to you, there are some of those who are standing here who will not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days later, Jesus took with Him Peter and James, and his brother John, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He was transfigured before them; and His face shone like the sun, and His garments became as white as light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter responded and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good that we are here. If You want, I will make three tabernacles here: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and behold, a voice from the cloud said, “This is My beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased; listen to Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples heard this, they fell face down to the ground and were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came to them and touched them and said, “Get up, and do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And raising their eyes, they saw no one except Jesus Himself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples asked Him, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said, “Elijah is coming and will restore all things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I say to you that Elijah already came, and they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted. So also the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that He had spoken to them about John the Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the crowd, a man came up to Jesus, falling on his knees before Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, because he has seizures and suffers terribly; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I brought him to Your disciples, and they could not cure him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said, “You unbelieving and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring him here to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, and the demon came out of him, and the boy was healed at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Because of your meager faith; for truly I say to you, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were gathering together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be handed over to men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will kill Him, and He will be raised on the third day.” And they were deeply grieved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they came to Capernaum, those who collected the two-drachma tax came to Peter and said, “Does your teacher not pay the two-drachma tax?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Yes.” And when he came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth collect customs or poll-tax, from their sons or from strangers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter said, “From strangers,” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are exempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, so that we do not offend them, go to the sea and throw in a hook, and take the first fish that comes up; and when you open its mouth, you will find a stater. Take that and give it to them for you and Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and said, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He called a child to Himself and set him among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Truly I say to you, unless you change and become like children, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So whoever will humble himself like this child, he is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever receives one such child in My name, receives Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to sin, it is better for him that a heavy millstone be hung around his neck, and that he be drowned in the depths of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the world because of its stumbling blocks! For it is inevitable that stumbling blocks come; but woe to the person through whom the stumbling block comes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if your hand or your foot is causing you to sin, cut it off and throw it away from you; it is better for you to enter life maimed or without a foot, than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into the eternal fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye is causing you to sin, tear it out and throw it away from you. It is better for you to enter life with one eye, than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fiery hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See that you do not look down on one of these little ones; for I say to you that their angels in heaven continually see the face of My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think? If any man has a hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains, and go and search for the one that is lost?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it turns out that he finds it, truly I say to you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine that have not gone astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven for one of these little ones to perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now if your brother sins, go and show him his fault in private; if he listens to you, you have gained your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not listen to you, take one or two more with you, so that on the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter may be confirmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, he is to be to you as a Gentile and a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, whatever you bind on earth shall have been bound in heaven; and whatever you loose on earth shall have been loosed in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again I say to you, that if two of you agree on earth about anything that they may ask, it shall be done for them by My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three have gathered together in My name, I am there in their midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came up and said to Him, “Lord, how many times shall my brother sin against me and I still forgive him? Up to seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy-seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this reason the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had begun to settle them, one who owed him ten thousand talents was brought to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since he did not have the means to repay, his master commanded that he be sold, along with his wife and children and all that he had, and repayment be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the slave fell to the ground and prostrated himself before him, saying, ‘Have patience with me and I will repay you everything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the master of that slave felt compassion, and he released him and forgave him the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that slave went out and found one of his fellow slaves who owed him a hundred denarii; and he seized him and began to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his fellow slave fell to the ground and began to plead with him, saying, ‘Have patience with me and I will repay you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was unwilling, and went and threw him in prison until he would pay back what was owed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were deeply grieved and came and reported to their master all that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then summoning him, his master said to him, ‘You wicked slave, I forgave you all that debt because you pleaded with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should you not also have had mercy on your fellow slave, in the same way that I had mercy on you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his master, moved with anger, handed him over to the torturers until he would repay all that was owed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My heavenly Father will also do the same to you, if each of you does not forgive his brother from your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these words, He left Galilee and came into the region of Judea beyond the Jordan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and large crowds followed Him, and He healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came to Jesus, testing Him and asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason at all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said, “Have you not read that He who created them from the beginning made them male and female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and his mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore, what God has joined together, no person is to separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Why, then, did Moses command to give her a certificate of divorce and send her away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart Moses permitted you to divorce your wives; but from the beginning it has not been this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another woman commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to Him, “If the relationship of the man with his wife is like this, it is better not to marry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “Not all men can accept this statement, but only those to whom it has been given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb; and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by people; and there are also eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept this, let him accept it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some children were brought to Him so that He would lay His hands on them and pray; and the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave the children alone, and do not forbid them to come to Me; for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After laying His hands on them, He departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And someone came to Him and said, “Teacher, what good thing shall I do so that I may obtain eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to him, “Why are you asking Me about what is good? There is only One who is good; but if you want to enter life, keep the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Him, “Which ones?” And Jesus said, “You shall not commit murder; You shall not commit adultery; You shall not steal; You shall not give false testimony;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor your father and mother; and You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said to Him, “All these I have kept; what am I still lacking?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be complete, go and sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard this statement, he went away grieving; for he was one who owned much property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to His disciples, “Truly I say to you, it will be hard for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples heard this, they were very astonished and said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking at them, Jesus said to them, “With people this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter responded and said to Him, “Behold, we have left everything and followed You; what then will there be for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you, that you who have followed Me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man will sit on His glorious throne, you also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or farms on account of My name, will receive many times as much, and will inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last; and the last, first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius for the day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to those he said, ‘You go into the vineyard also, and whatever is right, I will give you.’ And so they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing around; and he said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle all day long?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go into the vineyard too.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, starting with the last group to the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those hired about the eleventh hour came, each one received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so when those hired first came, they thought that they would receive more; but each of them also received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they received it, they grumbled at the landowner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘These who were hired last worked only one hour, and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the day’s work and the scorching heat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong; did you not agree with me for a denarius?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take what is yours and go; but I want to give to this last person the same as to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I want with what is my own? Or is your eye envious because I am generous?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the last shall be first, and the first, last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was about to go up to Jerusalem, He took the twelve disciples aside by themselves, and on the road He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn Him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will hand Him over to the Gentiles to mock and flog and crucify, and on the third day He will be raised up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to Jesus with her sons, bowing down and making a request of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to her, “What do you desire?” She said to Him, “Say that in Your kingdom these two sons of mine shall sit, one at Your right, and one at Your left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink?” They said to Him, “We are able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “My cup you shall drink; but to sit at My right and at My left is not Mine to give, but it is for those for whom it has been prepared by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after hearing this, the other ten disciples became indignant with the two brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to Himself and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles domineer over them, and those in high position exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not this way among you, but whoever wants to become prominent among you shall be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever desires to be first among you shall be your slave;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two people who were blind, sitting by the road, hearing that Jesus was passing by, cried out, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the crowd sternly warned them to be quiet; yet they cried out all the more, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stopped and called them, and said, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Lord, we want our eyes to be opened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes; and immediately they regained their sight and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had approached Jerusalem and had come to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, Jesus then sent two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied there and a colt with it. Untie them and bring them to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will send them on immediately.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this took place so that what was spoken through the prophet would be fulfilled:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say to the daughter of Zion,
‘Behold your King is coming to you,
Humble, and mounted on a donkey,
Even on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples went and did just as Jesus had instructed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought the donkey and the colt, and laid their cloaks on them; and He sat on the cloaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most of the crowd spread their cloaks on the road, and others were cutting branches from the trees and spreading them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: When He had entered Jerusalem, all the city was stirred, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds were saying, “This is Jesus the prophet, from Nazareth in Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all those who were selling and buying on the temple grounds, and He overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who were selling doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “It is written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer’; but you are making it a den of robbers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were blind and those who limped came to Him in the temple area, and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that He had done, and the children who were shouting in the temple area, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they became indignant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said to Him, “Do You hear what these children are saying?” And Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read, ‘From the mouths of infants and nursing babies You have prepared praise for Yourself’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the early morning, when He was returning to the city, He became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing a lone fig tree by the road, He came to it and found nothing on it except leaves alone; and He said to it, “No longer shall there ever be any fruit from you.” And at once the fig tree withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing this, the disciples were amazed and asked, “How did the fig tree wither all at once?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive it all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He entered the temple area, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to Him while He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things, and who gave You this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus responded and said to them, “I will also ask you one question, which, if you tell Me, I will also tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John was from what source: from heaven or from men?” And they began considering the implications among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the people; for they all regard John as a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And answering Jesus, they said, “We do not know.” He also said to them, “Neither am I telling you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, ‘Son, go work today in the vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he replied, ‘I do not want to.’ Yet afterward he regretted it and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man came to his second son and said the same thing; and he replied, ‘I will, sir’; and yet he did not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that the tax collectors and prostitutes will get into the kingdom of God before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness and you did not believe him; but the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe him; and you, seeing this, did not even have second thoughts afterward so as to believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to another parable. There was a landowner who planted a vineyard and put a fence around it, and dug a wine press in it, and built a tower, and he leased it to vine-growers and went on a journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the harvest time approached, he sent his slaves to the vine-growers to receive his fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the vine-growers took his slaves and beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent other slaves, more than the first; and they did the same things to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the vine-growers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir; come, let’s kill him and take possession of his inheritance!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took him and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vine-growers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end and lease the vineyard to other vine-growers, who will pay him the fruit in the proper seasons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Did you never read in the Scriptures,
‘A stone which the builders rejected,
This has become the chief cornerstone;
This came about from the Lord,
And it is marvelous in our eyes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people producing its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; and on whomever it falls, it will crush him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard His parables, they understood that He was speaking about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although they sought to arrest Him, they feared the crowds, since they considered Him to be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who held a wedding feast for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent his slaves to call those who had been invited to the wedding feast, and they were unwilling to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent other slaves, saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and my fattened cattle are all butchered and everything is ready. Come to the wedding feast!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they paid no attention and went their separate ways, one to his own farm, another to his business,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the rest seized his slaves and treated them abusively, and then killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king was angry, and he sent his armies and destroyed those murderers and set their city on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his slaves, ‘The wedding feast is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So go to the main roads, and invite whomever you find there to the wedding feast.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those slaves went out into the streets and gathered together all whom they found, both bad and good; and the wedding hall was filled with dinner guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the king came in to look over the dinner guests, he saw a man there who was not dressed in wedding clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ And the man was speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Tie his hands and feet, and throw him into the outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth in that place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went and plotted together how they might trap Him in what He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent their disciples to Him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and teach the way of God in truth, and do not care what anyone thinks; for You are not partial to anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us then, what do You think? Is it permissible to pay a poll-tax to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their malice, and said, “Why are you testing Me, you hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show Me the coin used for the poll-tax.” And they brought Him a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Caesar’s.” Then He said to them, “Then pay to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s; and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hearing this, they were amazed; and they left Him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day some Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to Jesus and questioned Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies having no children, his brother as next of kin shall marry his wife, and raise up children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers among us; and the first married and died, and having no children, he left his wife to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the same also with the second brother, and the third, down to the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last of all, the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had her in marriage.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them, “You are mistaken, since you do not understand the Scriptures nor the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But regarding the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, a lawyer, asked Him a question, testing Him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which is the great commandment in the Law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to him, “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the great and foremost commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is like it, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon these two commandments hang the whole Law and the Prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is He?” They said to Him, “The son of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then how does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
Until I put Your enemies under Your feet”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if David calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one was able to offer Him a word in answer, nor did anyone dare from that day on to ask Him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying: “The scribes and the Pharisees have seated themselves in the chair of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, whatever they tell you, do and comply with it all, but do not do as they do; for they say things and do not do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they tie up heavy burdens and lay them on people’s shoulders, but they themselves are unwilling to move them with so much as their finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they do all their deeds to be noticed by other people; for they broaden their phylacteries and lengthen the tassels of their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they love the place of honor at banquets, and the seats of honor in the synagogues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and personal greetings in the marketplaces, and being called Rabbi by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, do not be called Rabbi; for only One is your Teacher, and you are all brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not call anyone on earth your father; for only One is your Father, He who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not be called leaders; for only One is your Leader, that is, Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the greatest of you shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever exalts himself shall be humbled, and whoever humbles himself shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you shut the kingdom of heaven in front of people; for you do not enter it yourselves, nor do you allow those who are entering to go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you travel around on sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, that is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools and blind men! Which is more important, the gold or the temple that sanctified the gold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you say, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, that is nothing; but whoever swears by the offering that is on it is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind men, which is more important, the offering or the altar that sanctifies the offering?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, the one who swears by the altar, swears both by the altar and by everything on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who swears by the temple, swears both by the temple and by Him who dwells in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who swears by heaven, swears both by the throne of God and by Him who sits upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint and dill and cumin, and have neglected the weightier provisions of the Law: justice and mercy and faithfulness; but these are the things you should have done without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the dish, but inside they are full of robbery and self-indulgence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and of the dish, so that the outside of it may also become clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs which on the outside appear beautiful, but inside they are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you too, outwardly appear righteous to people, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs for the prophets and decorate the monuments of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you say, ‘If we had been living in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partners with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you testify against yourselves, that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fill up, then, the measure of the guilt of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You snakes, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape the sentence of hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, I am sending you prophets and wise men and scribes; some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will flog in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that upon you will fall the guilt of all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who have been sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, the way a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were unwilling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is being left to you desolate!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say to you, from now on you will not see Me until you say, ‘Blessed is the One who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left the temple area and was going on His way when His disciples came up to point out the temple buildings to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He responded and said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you, not one stone here will be left upon another, which will not be torn down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as He was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign of Your coming, and of the end of the age?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “See to it that no one misleads you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will mislead many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will be hearing of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not alarmed, for those things must take place, but that is not yet the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things are merely the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will hand you over to tribulation and kill you, and you will be hated by all nations because of My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that time many will fall away, and they will betray one another and hate one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many false prophets will rise up and mislead many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because lawlessness is increased, most people’s love will become cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who endures to the end is the one who will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore when you see the abomination of desolation which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place—let the reader understand—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is on the housetop must not go down to get things out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever is in the field must not turn back to get his cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to those women who are pregnant, and to those who are nursing babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, pray that when you flee, it will not be in the winter, or on a Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then there will be a great tribulation, such as has not occurred since the beginning of the world until now, nor ever will again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if those days had not been cut short, no life would have been saved; but for the sake of the elect those days will be cut short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or ‘He is over here,’ do not believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false christs and false prophets will arise and will provide great signs and wonders, so as to mislead, if possible, even the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have told you in advance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if they say to you, ‘Behold, He is in the wilderness,’ do not go out; or, ‘Behold, He is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the lightning comes from the east and flashes as far as the west, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He will send forth His angels with a great trumpet blast, and they will gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: as soon as its branch has become tender and sprouts its leaves, you know that summer is near;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so you too, when you see all these things, recognize that He is near, right at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But about that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven, nor the Son, but the Father alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the coming of the Son of Man will be just like the days of Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in those days before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they did not understand until the flood came and took them all away; so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time there will be two men in the field; one will be taken and one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken and one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore be on the alert, for you do not know which day your Lord is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be sure of this, that if the head of the house had known at what time of the night the thief was coming, he would have been on the alert and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason you must be ready as well; for the Son of Man is coming at an hour when you do not think He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who then is the faithful and sensible slave whom his master put in charge of his household slaves, to give them their food at the proper time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that slave whom his master finds so doing when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil slave says in his heart, ‘My master is not coming for a long time,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he begins to beat his fellow slaves, and he eats and drinks with those habitually drunk;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the master of that slave will come on a day that he does not expect, and at an hour that he does not know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will cut him in two and assign him a place with the hypocrites; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the kingdom of heaven will be comparable to ten virgins, who took their lamps and went out to meet the groom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the foolish took their lamps, they did not take extra oil with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the prudent ones took oil in flasks with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the groom was delaying, they all became drowsy and began to sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at midnight there finally was a shout: ‘Behold, the groom! Come out to meet him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the foolish virgins said to the prudent ones, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the prudent ones answered, ‘No, there most certainly would not be enough for us and you too; go instead to the merchants and buy some for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the groom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding feast; and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet later, the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, lord, open up for us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, ‘Truly I say to you, I do not know you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on the alert then, because you do not know the day nor the hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For it is just like a man about to go on a journey, who called his own slaves and entrusted his possessions to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To one he gave five talents, to another, two, and to another, one, each according to his own ability; and he went on his journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had received the five talents immediately went and did business with them, and earned five more talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way the one who had received the two talents earned two more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who received the one talent went away and dug a hole in the ground, and hid his master’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now after a long time the master of those slaves came and settled accounts with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had received the five talents came up and brought five more talents, saying, ‘Master, you entrusted five talents to me. See, I have earned five more talents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave. You were faithful with a few things, I will put you in charge of many things; enter the joy of your master.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also the one who had received the two talents came up and said, ‘Master, you entrusted two talents to me. See, I have earned two more talents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave. You were faithful with a few things, I will put you in charge of many things; enter the joy of your master.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the one who had received the one talent also came up and said, ‘Master, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was afraid, so I went away and hid your talent in the ground. See, you still have what is yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But his master answered and said to him, ‘You worthless, lazy slave! Did you know that I reap where I did not sow, and gather where I did not scatter seed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you ought to have put my money in the bank, and on my arrival I would have received my money back with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore: take the talent away from him, and give it to the one who has the ten talents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For to everyone who has, more shall be given, and he will have an abundance; but from the one who does not have, even what he does have shall be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And throw the worthless slave into the outer darkness; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the angels with Him, then He will sit on His glorious throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the nations will be gathered before Him; and He will separate them from one another, just as the shepherd separates the sheep from the goats;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He will put the sheep on His right, but the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the King will say to those on His right, ‘Come, you who are blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was hungry, and you gave Me something to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave Me something to drink; I was a stranger, and you invited Me in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: naked, and you clothed Me; I was sick, and you visited Me; I was in prison, and you came to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will answer Him, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry, and feed You, or thirsty, and give You something to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when did we see You as a stranger, and invite You in, or naked, and clothe You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King will answer and say to them, ‘Truly I say to you, to the extent that you did it for one of the least of these brothers or sisters of Mine, you did it for Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then He will also say to those on His left, ‘Depart from Me, you accursed people, into the eternal fire which has been prepared for the devil and his angels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was hungry, and you gave Me nothing to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave Me nothing to drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and you did not invite Me in; naked, and you did not clothe Me; sick, and in prison, and you did not visit Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they themselves also will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry, or thirsty, or as a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not take care of You?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He will answer them, ‘Truly I say to you, to the extent that you did not do it for one of the least of these, you did not do it for Me, either.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished all these words, He said to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man is to be handed over for crucifixion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the chief priests and the elders of the people were gathered together in the courtyard of the high priest named Caiaphas;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they plotted together to arrest Jesus covertly and kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were saying, “Not during the festival, otherwise a riot might occur among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, at the home of Simon the Leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a woman came to Him with an alabaster vial of very expensive perfume, and she poured it on His head as He was reclining at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the disciples were indignant when they saw this, and said, “Why this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this perfume could have been sold for a high price and the money given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, aware of this, said to them, “Why are you bothering the woman? For she has done a good deed for Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you; but you do not always have Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when she poured this perfume on My body, she did it to prepare Me for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “What are you willing to give me to betray Him to you?” And they set out for him thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from then on he looked for a good opportunity to betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near; I am keeping the Passover at your house with My disciples.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were eating, He said, “Truly I say to you that one of you will betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being deeply grieved, they began saying to Him, each one: “Surely it is not I, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered, “He who dipped his hand with Me in the bowl is the one who will betray Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going away just as it is written about Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas, who was betraying Him, said, “Surely it is not I, Rabbi?” Jesus said to him, “You have said it yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were eating, Jesus took some bread, and after a blessing, He broke it and gave it to the disciples, and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had taken a cup and given thanks, He gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is My blood of the covenant, which is being poured out for many for forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it with you, new, in My Father’s kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away because of Me this night, for it is written: ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have been raised, I will go ahead of you to Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter replied to Him, “Even if they all fall away because of You, I will never fall away!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you that this very night, before a rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” All the disciples said the same thing as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and told His disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with Him, and began to be grieved and distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, to the point of death; remain here and keep watch with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He went a little beyond them, and fell on His face and prayed, saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me; yet not as I will, but as You will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and He said to Peter, “So, you men could not keep watch with Me for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep watching and praying, so that you do not come into temptation; the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away again a second time and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cup cannot pass away unless I drink from it, Your will be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He left them again, and went away and prayed a third time, saying the same thing once more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is at hand and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, let’s go; behold, the one who is betraying Me is near!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came accompanied by a large crowd with swords and clubs, who came from the chief priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who was betraying Him gave them a sign previously, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the one; arrest Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately Judas went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Friend, do what you have come for.” Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and arrested Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of those who were with Jesus reached and drew his sword, and struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place; for all those who take up the sword will perish by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you think that I cannot appeal to My Father, and He will at once put at My disposal more than twelve legions of angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled, which say that it must happen this way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus said to the crowds, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest Me as you would against a man inciting a revolt? Every day I used to sit within the temple grounds teaching, and you did not arrest Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all this has taken place so that the Scriptures of the prophets will be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples left Him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had arrested Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter was following Him at a distance, as far as the courtyard of the high priest, and he came inside and sat down with the officers to see the outcome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the entire Council kept trying to obtain false testimony against Jesus, so that they might put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not find any, even though many false witnesses came forward. But later on two came forward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “This man stated, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to rebuild it in three days.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest stood up and said to Him, “Do You offer no answer for what these men are testifying against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest said to Him, “I place You under oath by the living God, to tell us whether You are the Christ, the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have said it yourself. But I tell you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his robes and said, “He has blasphemed! What further need do we have of witnesses? See, you have now heard the blasphemy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what do you think?” They answered, “He deserves death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spit in His face and beat Him with their fists; and others slapped Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Prophesy to us, You Christ; who is the one who hit You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and a slave woman came to him and said, “You too were with Jesus the Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone out to the gateway, another slave woman saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he denied it, with an oath: “I do not know the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little later the bystanders came up and said to Peter, “You really are one of them as well, since even the way you talk gives you away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to curse and swear, “I do not know the Man!” And immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter remembered the statement that Jesus had made: “Before a rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” And he went out and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when morning came, all the chief priests and the elders of the people conferred together against Jesus to put Him to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they bound Him and led Him away, and handed Him over to Pilate the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Judas, who had betrayed Him, saw that He had been condemned, he felt remorse and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? You shall see to it yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he threw the pieces of silver into the temple sanctuary and left; and he went away and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver and said, “It is not lawful to put them in the temple treasury, since it is money paid for blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they conferred together and with the money bought the Potter’s Field as a burial place for strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the One whose price had been set by the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they gave them for the Potter’s Field, just as the Lord directed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor questioned Him, saying, “So You are the King of the Jews?” And Jesus said to him, “It is as you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He was being accused by the chief priests and elders, He did not offer any answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear how many things they are testifying against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And still He did not answer him in regard to even a single charge, so the governor was greatly amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the Passover Feast the governor was accustomed to release for the people any one prisoner whom they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that time they were holding a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the people gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release for you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that it was because of envy that they had handed Him over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message, saying, “See that you have nothing to do with that righteous Man; for last night I suffered greatly in a dream because of Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas, and to put Jesus to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the governor said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?” They all said, “Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Why, what evil has He done?” Yet they kept shouting all the more, saying, “Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pilate saw that he was accomplishing nothing, but rather that a riot was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd, saying, “I am innocent of this Man’s blood; you yourselves shall see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people replied, “His blood shall be on us and on our children!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he released Barabbas for them; but after having Jesus flogged, he handed Him over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole Roman cohort to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stripped Him and put a red cloak on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after twisting together a crown of thorns, they put it on His head, and put a reed in His right hand; and they knelt down before Him and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spit on Him, and took the reed and beat Him on the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had mocked Him, they took the cloak off Him and put His own garments back on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming out, they found a man of Cyrene named Simon, whom they compelled to carry His cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to a place called Golgotha, which means Place of a Skull,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gave Him wine mixed with bile to drink; and after tasting it, He was unwilling to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had crucified Him, they divided His garments among themselves by casting lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sitting down, they began to keep watch over Him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And above His head they put up the charge against Him which read, “THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time two rebels were being crucified with Him, one on the right and one on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those passing by were speaking abusively to Him, shaking their heads,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “You who are going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way the chief priests also, along with the scribes and elders, were mocking Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others; He cannot save Himself! He is the King of Israel; let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has trusted in God; let God rescue Him now, if He takes pleasure in Him; for He said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rebels who had been crucified with Him were also insulting Him in the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour darkness fell upon all the land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lema sabaktanei?” that is, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of those who were standing there, when they heard it, said, “This man is calling for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately one of them ran, and taking a sponge, he filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed, and gave Him a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the rest of them said, “Let us see if Elijah comes to save Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and gave up His spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom; and the earth shook and the rocks were split.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and coming out of the tombs after His resurrection, they entered the holy city and appeared to many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for the centurion and those who were with him keeping guard over Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the other things that were happening, they became extremely frightened and said, “Truly this was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
