verses.text: And many women were there watching from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee while caring for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening, a rich man from Arimathea came, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered it to be given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the entrance of the tomb and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the next day, that is, the day which is after the preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered together with Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, “Sir, we remember that when that deceiver was still alive, He said, ‘After three days I am rising.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, give orders for the tomb to be made secure until the third day; otherwise, His disciples may come and steal Him, and say to the people, ‘He has risen from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard; go, make it as secure as you know how.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and made the tomb secure with the guard, sealing the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to look at the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a severe earthquake had occurred, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came and rolled away the stone, and sat upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his appearance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The guards shook from fear of him and became like dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid; for I know that you are looking for Jesus who has been crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, for He has risen, just as He said. Come, see the place where He was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And go quickly and tell His disciples that He has risen from the dead; and behold, He is going ahead of you to Galilee. There you will see Him; behold, I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they left the tomb quickly with fear and great joy, and ran to report to His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Jesus met them and said, “Rejoice!” And they came up and took hold of His feet, and worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid; go, bring word to My brothers to leave for Galilee, and there they will see Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were on their way, some of the men from the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests all that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came at night and stole Him while we were asleep.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if this comes to the governor’s ears, we will appease him and keep you out of trouble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took the money and did as they had been instructed; and this story was widely spread among the Jews and is to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the eleven disciples proceeded to Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had designated to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some were doubtful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came up and spoke to them, saying, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, therefore, and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: teaching them to follow all that I commanded you; and behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
